metadata.title: CVE-2017-5604 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An incorrect implementation of "XEP-0280: Message Carbons" in multiple XMPPclients allows a remote attacker to impersonate any user, includingcontacts, in the vulnerable application's display. This allows for variouskinds of social engineering attacks. This CVE is for mcabber 1.0.0 - 1.0.4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mcabber - 1.1.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mcabber package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.0-1').
